opposite_reasoning: DecodingProcedure is the strongest opposite for EncodingProcedure as they represent complementary inverse operations in information processing. Encoding transforms information into a coded form, while decoding reverses this process. This pairing is: (1) semantically natural and well-established in information theory, (2) likely to exist in both WordNet and SUMO as fundamental information processing concepts, (3) provides strong directional contrast for Fisher-LDA axes, and (4) relevant for AI safety monitoring where understanding the distinction between information encoding/obfuscation vs. decoding/revelation is important for transparency and interpretability.
